author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4676

Default color using familiar console icon, but with avatar (Posh-chan) colors

![icon](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SteveL-MSFT/PowerShell/new-icon/assets/av_colors_128.svg?sanitize=true)
<!--

If you are a PowerShell Team member, please make sure you choose the Reviewer(s) and Assignee for your PR.
If you are not from the PowerShell Team, you can leave the fields blank and the Maintainers will choose them for you. If you are familiar with the team, feel free to mention some Reviewers yourself.

For more information about the roles of Reviewer and Assignee, refer to [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md).

-->

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Latest change is to add some customer bitmaps to the installer:

![installer](https://imgur.com/hXpkmb8.png)
![page2](https://imgur.com/3tCTo9r.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Can we make this woman's face beautiful? Only I think it skewed?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov are you referring to the "mouth"?  that's the cursor of the prompt, sort of like `>_`

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Yes,  "mouth", "nose" - I'd preffer see a nice face. Can we make from >_ a purse? :-)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov I think it's too late to make changes to Posh-chan.  It came from a pro designer and it's what we've been using in some marketing.  I'm just reusing one of the original assets.  Think of it more as "war paint" on her face ;P

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
Last change is to fix the `Launch PowerShell` checkbox as the default control has a grey background which overlaps with the black icon.  Now it looks like

![launch](https://imgur.com/ePdEEA1.png)

comments.author: DimaRazb
comments.body: She seems very aggressive, I don't like her very much. Designer could use a purse or raincoat I believe.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT It's unclear to me which one is the default in this PR. Does it need to be updated to the black icon by default still? 

Otherwise, LGTM. Love the new MSI look-and-feel.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @PowerShell/powershell-committee reviewed this and fine with the changes

title: New icon for PowerShell Core
